title: Biden gives first Oval Office address since ending 2024 reelection bid | Special Report
description: President Biden addressed the nation Wednesday for the first time since announcing he's ending his reelection campaign and endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris for the Democratic presidential nomination. Mr. Biden laid out his plans for the rest of his first term.

title: Israel retrieves bodies of 5 hostages believed killed Oct. 7, military says
description: Israel's military says it recovered the bodies of five people believed to have been killed during the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas militants​ on southern Israel and brought into the Gaza Strip, where they were being held hostage.

title: Murder suspect arrested in Mexico after 19-year manhunt
description: Luis Contreras allegedly killed Alfonso Vera, who was trying to stop another man from beating a woman.

title: U.S. intercepts Russian, Chinese bombers off Alaskan coast
description: The bombers were intercepted by U.S. and Canadian fighter jets in the Alaska Air Defense Identification Zone.

title: Missouri Supreme Court halts release of man after murder conviction overturned
description: A St. Louis Circuit Court judge had ordered Christopher Dunn be released by Wednesday evening, and threatened the warden with contempt if he wasn't.

title: Breaking down Biden's Oval Office address on exiting 2024 race
description: President Biden addressed the nation from the Oval Office Wednesday night in his first public remarks since his decision to drop out of the 2024 race on Sunday. Mr. Biden said the best way forward was to pass the torch to a new generation. Skyler Henry, CBS News correspondent, and Lindsay Chervinsky, executive director of the George Washington Presidential Library, join with more.

title: Biden delivers Oval Office address following historic decision to leave race
description: President Biden Wednesday night addressed the nation from the Oval Office regarding his decision to end his reelection bid. Mr. Biden said that "nothing can come in the way of saving our democracy. That includes personal ambition." Nancy Cordes has more.

title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Wednesday, July 24, 2024
description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."

title: Biden says nothing can get in way of saving democracy, including "personal ambition"
description: President Biden said it's been the privilege of his life to serve the country for over 50 years.

title: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker reacts to Biden's 2024 exit speech
description: President Biden addressed the nation from the Oval Office Wednesday night in his first public remarks since his decision to drop out of the 2024 presidential race on Sunday. Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker joined CBS News with his reaction to the speech.

title: Watch Biden's Oval Office address about ending his 2024 bid
description: President Biden made his first public remarks Wednesday night since his decision to drop out of the presidential race on Sunday. Speaking from the Oval Office, Mr. Biden said that saving democracy is more important than any title, and he acknowledged it was time to "pass the torch" to a new generation of leaders. "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell leads special coverage.

title: Extended Interview: Sonya Massey's son and mother say she'd still be alive if she wasn't Black
description: In this extended interview, Sonya Massey's mother, Donna, and son, Malachi, speak out about the fatal police shooting of the 36-year-old inside her home in Springfield, Illinois, saying they believe the sheriff's deputy wouldn't have done it at all if she hadn't been Black. Former Sangamon County Sheriff's Deputy Sean Grayson has pleaded not guilty to charges of first-degree murder, aggravated battery with a firearm and official misconduct. CBS News' Roxana Saberi reports.

title: Trump holds first rally since Biden stepped aside
description: On Wednesday night, Donald Trump held his first campaign rally since President Biden dropped out of the 2024 race. The former president launched several attacks on his presumptive opponent, Vice President Kamala Harris, saying she "can't be trusted" and is "unfit to lead." CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports from Charlotte, North Carolina.

title: Maggots and other bugs released at Netanyahu's hotel in D.C.
description: Video posted on Wednesday showed a large number of maggots and other bugs crawling through the Watergate Hotel, where Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is staying during his visit​ to Washington, D.C.

title: Harris closer to being nominee as DNC approves early virtual roll call vote
description: The convention rules committee approved an early August timeline, leaving a small window for any Harris challengers.

title: Drones spot swimmers in rip currents, assisting rescues
description: The town of Oak Island is one of a few places in the country deploying drones for ocean rescue.

title: New Zealand probe exposes decades of abuse by state and faith-based groups
description: An independent inquiry in New Zealand found that state and religious institutions failed to prevent the abuse of hundreds of thousands of children and vulnerable adults over the last seven decades. CBS News' Ian Lee has the details.

title: Netanyahu gives tense address to Congress
description: With thousands of protesters rallying near the Capitol Wednesday, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed a joint session of Congress, urging it to continue financially backing Israel in its war with Hamas despite growing criticism that Israeli leadership has been unable to reach a cease-fire deal that would free the remaining hostages. Dozens of congressional Democrats boycotted the address. Scott MacFarlane has the latest.

title: Increased immigration could boost U.S. economy, report finds
description: Immigration and the economy are among some of the key issues for voters in the 2024 election. Now, a new report from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office suggests that migrants coming to the U.S. could help the country's financial situation. CBS News immigration and politics reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez joins to unpack the findings.

title: FBI director reveals new details about Trump shooting at House hearing
description: FBI Director Christopher Wray faced questions from the House Judiciary Committee about the bureau's investigation into the Trump assassination attempt.

title: Israelis protest Netanyahu's U.S. trip as violence escalates in Gaza
description: As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday, protesters in Tel Aviv took to the streets, criticizing him for the visit. Meanwhile, the Israeli military is increasing attacks on Gaza. CBS News foreign correspondent Debra Patta has the latest.

title: Drone technology used to rescue distressed swimmers
description: The fire department in Oak Island, North Carolina, is one of the few in the nation using drone technology to help rescue swimmers who get stranded in the Atlantic Ocean. The drones are equipped with infrared to spot distressed swimmers, and emergency responders can communicate instructions through a speaker. Manuel Bojorquez has more.

title: Wildfires continue to rage across western U.S. and Canada
description: Multiple wildfires on the West Coast and in Canada have forced thousands of people to evacuate. Crews are fighting flames in California, Oregon, Utah and Idaho. CBS News national correspondent Jonathan Vigliotti reports.

title: Harris and Trump launch lines of attack on campaign trail
description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump were on the trail Wednesday as their respective presidential campaigns shift with the changing political field. CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa has more.

title: Coco Gauff named flag bearer for U.S. Olympic team
description: Tennis star Coco Gauff has been selected as one of the two flag bearers for the U.S. Olympic team during the opening ceremony of the Paris Games, along with the NBA's LeBron James.

title: Heat fuels wildfires across West, and other top headlines
description: Here are some of the Wednesday's top stories, including a plane crash that killed 18 people in Nepal, how sweltering heat is fueling dozens of wildfires in Idaho and Oregon, and two men who survived after a whale crashed into their boat, sending them overboard. Kris Van Cleave, Jonathan Vigliotti and Carter Evans report.

title: Key takeaways from Netanyahu's address to Congress
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed a joint meeting of Congress on Wednesday. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane reports from Capitol Hill. Then, Jon Alterman, senior vice president and director of the Middle East Program at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins to break down Netanyahu's speech.

title: What we learned about Trump assassination attempt from FBI testimony
description: FBI Director Christopher Wray testified on Capitol Hill Wednesday about the investigation into the assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump. While Wray didn't divulge too many details about the investigation, he did offer some new information about the shooter. Anna Schecter, senior coordinating producer for CBS News' crime and public safety unit, has the details.

title: FBI director testifies on security lapses in Trump rally shooting
description: FBI Director Christopher Wray gave chilling testimony Wednesday before the House Judiciary Committee about the investigation into the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump. Wray revealed that on the same day the gunman registered for Trump's rally, he also did a Google search on his laptop for "how far away was Oswald from Kennedy?" Nicole Sganga and Jennifer Borrasso report.

title: Harris team vets VP candidates as campaign works to build its coalition
description: CBS News has learned Vice President Kamala Harris' team is vetting about a dozen possible vice presidential candidates, including Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro and Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg. It comes as her campaign seeks to take advantage of a surge in enthusiasm among Democrats since she announced her candidacy. Weijia Jiang reports.
